p: There is considerable variation in the range of flowering DOY of each species over the 120 years (Table 1, Figure 3). The species with the least variation was Erysimum pallasii (Pursh) Fernald, with a range of 43 days. The species with the greatest variation in flowering DOY was the snow bed species Ranunculus nivalis L., with a range of 88 days. The order of flowering (Figure 3) is consistent with recent observations (Panchen & Gorelick, 2016), indicating that the collection flowering time data are representative of species’ relative time of flowering through the growing season.
